objectives.primary_objective: Evaluate how well students understand science, observation, curiosity, and asking questions.
learning_outcomes: Recall and explain what science means.
Identify examples of observation and questioning.
Use vocabulary words correctly in context.

content_blocks.text: Today is our progress day! Let’s see how much we’ve learned about science, asking questions, and observing things around us!
Question 1: What does science mean? Try to explain in your own words.

alternate_expressions: Science means learning by observing and asking why.
Science helps us discover new things about the world.
Science is exploring to understand how things work.
ai_expression_coach.ai_prompt: Can you express what science means in your own words?

ai_followup_feedback.neutral_response: Good! Try adding how we observe or ask questions.
ai_followup_feedback.incorrect_response: Let’s fix it together: Science means learning by observing and asking questions.

content_blocks.text: Question 2: Can you ask one science question about something around you?

ai_expression_coach.ai_prompt: Try rephrasing your question using 'Why', 'How', or 'What'.

ai_followup_feedback.neutral_response: Good try! Add a 'why' or 'how' to make it clearer.
ai_followup_feedback.incorrect_response: Let’s correct it: Start with 'Why', 'How', or 'What'.

content_blocks.text: Question 3: Describe any one object near you using two or more senses. For example: I can see, I can hear, I can touch...

alternate_expressions: I can see the clock and hear it tick.
I can feel the soft paper and see its color.
I observe the window, the sound of birds, and the smell of flowers.
ai_expression_coach.ai_prompt: Can you describe what you observed using more details?

ai_followup_feedback.positive_response: Excellent! You used your senses well.
ai_followup_feedback.neutral_response: Nice! Try adding one more sense to make it complete.
ai_followup_feedback.incorrect_response: Let’s fix it: Use 'I can see' or 'I can hear' to start your sentence.

content_blocks.text: You did an amazing job this week! Remember — science begins with curiosity, grows with observation, and shines with questions!

star_rating_system.promotion_rule: Minimum 2 stars required to unlock next module (Week 2).

weaknesses_analysis: Needs to use more complete sentences when describing things.

for_two_star_students.growth_feedback: Good progress! Try redoing one activity using fuller sentences or adding one more sense to earn your 3rd star.
example_phrases_for_retry: Science means asking and observing things around me.
I can see a flower, smell it, and touch its soft petals.

for_three_star_students.mastery_feedback: Fantastic! You’ve mastered all Week 1 concepts — observation, curiosity, and questioning like a true young scientist!
